list.item: A busy life for us all

div1.p: Dearest Jane - It's about 8 p.m. this Thursday evening & hope to soon be in bed - would have written you last night but just didn't have the pep - Things have been buzzing so lately - Monday after school - the girls practiced their song - then I dashed over to Huffs' to see about Estel's costume for the play & of course couldn't get away till almost dark - Then was supper & before it was devoured - Cara & Tom McCarter arrived about getting help for their Latin & stayed all evening - They are such nice youngsters & so worth while helping in every way - Tom is perfectly killing - one never knows what he will say next.

Tuesday we practised on the play & I was over at the school house till dark & spent evening remodeling the sun bonnets in my Fair drill into Puritan bonnets & visiting
with Evelyn & Miss Langmaid - Last night when I got back here Dr. Massey was just going up the road in his Ford to the Ogles - (Ephraines) about a mile up the river - I decided to go along & make a call at Lucretties as she was not in school that p.m. We had quite a time getting the car started - Harrison & I both helped Dan (the horse) even came up back of us to see what was doing. Finally a man on horseback came up & solved the trouble & away we went. Lucrettie was all huddled over the fire - a big silk handkerchief on her brow. After visiting a little I persuaded her to go for a walk & gather some of the pine & hemlock boughs covered with cones - perfectly beautiful. We got a big armful
which I left at the school to be fixed this morning - (four baskets!)

Evelyn & Miss Langmaid I discovered on my return had gone down the road toward Sevierville with the doctor on his way back so walked down that way to meet them as they returned on foot. We all enjoy these little snatches of rides so much! But it began to get dark - really dark & no sign of them so returned home.

We ate supper & still they didn't come - I finally concluded they went all the way into Sevierville which surmise proved correct. Abbie has had a bad cold all week as so many are afflicted at present & came home at recess sick enough to go to bed - The doctor prescribed calomel so Emily & I fussed around with her some & then I went over to the cottage to stay all night with the Carr girls in her place. It sure is cold these days - am wearing my big old coat & wool dresses.

Tonight after school - Cora practiced the 23rd Psalm which she sings while spinning. She just suits the part of Priscilla too. About 4:30 Emily & I started off & called at the Andrew Ogles' just below our bungalow the ones who caused so much trouble between Marshall - (their son) & Mary & who said so much about us! The father is a regular patriarch in appearance & can't won't do a bit of work sits around at the stores &
on his porch - gossips most of the time - but no wonder - he can neither read nor write and has absolutely nothing to take his mind off his neighbors' affairs! Cora the daughter whom I have in school is lovely a regular little beauty - big black eyes - dark hair & pretty features. We (Emily & I) are planning to take an all day hike with her & Lucrettie during Thanksgiving vacation! Well - as we left their house we met Mrs. Huff & little Blanche looking for Mr. H. & the Ford as Evelyn had phoned from Pigeon Forge for someone to meet them. Poor Harrison had to go with Dan as no trace could be found of Mr. H. We walked part way home with her getting back at dark - Aunt Lizzie was
making cocoa - & had put some bread in the oven to toast - I had the bright idea of sprinnkling grated cheese over it - & by the time it was ready & some remnants of chicken & gravy warmed over - the two ladies arrived - Said they decided to go on to Sevierville as the doctor said he'd take them up to Wears Valley to see about baskets (had to see visit a patient).

We had our supper all together after all - & then tried Ned's songs which came from Uncle Art today - I like them very much - & Evelyn thinks them very good. She has not yet given me a lesson - but eventually she may get around to it - We had a helter skelter life
you see -
By the way please find out as soon as possible where we may get the powdered paint for our toys - We must get at them next.

p.del: Do you like this kind of a letter? Have not made one comment on yours have I?

Shall be so glad to have the kodaks of the children - should think Nellie would be weary at times! Miss Langmaid wanted some of my kodaks & just sold them to her & will get duplicates to send you - The one of my hat did not come out - & the other of my gray dress is only so so! It will be fine for them (Arthur & Nell) to have a real house & yard - I never felt that the other house suited them somehow - Is the office moved? Wouldn't it be fine th for that land to bring something in!
Yes I do take care of myself sensibly and do not court colds, wet feet, etc. What took Bessie to Chicago? Wonder what she will think of our relations?
I don't know what I want for Xmas - Honestly - unless it's my silver mirror & that is very unnecessary & expensive -
Would like a lot more of those photogravures - if you want to say good by to them as those I have are awfully flyspecked -

Guess you all will have to have some more baskets from me - Thought I might have time to make some things but sure won't. Hope you got the others & liked them. Must say goodnight dearest Jane & with so much of love to you all - Ruth
